verses.kjv: The word of the LORD came again unto me, saying,
verses.web: LORD’s word came again to me, saying,
verses.ct: The word of the LORD came to me again:

verses.kjv: Son of man, prophesy and say, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Howl ye, Woe worth the day!
verses.web: “Son of man, prophesy, and say, ‘The Lord LORD says: “Wail, ‘Alas for the day!’
verses.ct: "Son of man, prophesy and say, 'This is what the Lord GOD declares: Cry out in grief — what a terrible day is coming!'

verses.kjv: For the day is near, even the day of the LORD is near, a cloudy day; it shall be the time of the heathen.
verses.web: For the day is near, even LORD’s day is near. It will be a day of clouds, a time of the nations.
verses.ct: The day is close — the day of the LORD is near. It will be a day covered in clouds, a time of judgment on the nations.

verses.kjv: And the sword shall come upon Egypt, and great pain shall be in Ethiopia, when the slain shall fall in Egypt, and they shall take away her multitude, and her foundations shall be broken down.
verses.web: A sword will come on Egypt, and anguish will be in Ethiopia, when the slain fall in Egypt. They take away her multitude, and her foundations are broken down.
verses.ct: A sword will strike Egypt, and Ethiopia will writhe in anguish. When the dead pile up in Egypt, her wealth will be carried off and her foundations torn apart.

verses.kjv: Ethiopia, and Libya, and Lydia, and all the mingled people, and Chub, and the men of the land that is in league, shall fall with them by the sword.
verses.web: “ ‘ “Ethiopia, Put, Lud, all the mixed people, Cub, and the children of the land that is allied with them, will fall with them by the sword.”
verses.ct: Ethiopia, Libya, Lydia, all the mixed peoples, Chub, and the people of every allied nation will fall by the sword alongside Egypt.

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD; They also that uphold Egypt shall fall; and the pride of her power shall come down: from the tower of Syene shall they fall in it by the sword, saith the Lord GOD.
verses.web: “ ‘LORD says: “They also who uphold Egypt will fall. The pride of her power will come down. They will fall by the sword in it from the tower of Seveneh,” says the Lord LORD.
verses.ct: This is what the LORD says: Everyone who props up Egypt will fall. The power she was so proud of will collapse. From the tower of Syene to every corner, they will die by the sword, declares the Lord GOD.

verses.kjv: And they shall be desolate in the midst of the countries that are desolate, and her cities shall be in the midst of the cities that are wasted.
verses.web: “They will be desolate in the middle of the countries that are desolate. Her cities will be among the cities that are wasted.
verses.ct: Egypt will be left desolate among ruined nations, and her cities will sit empty among devastated cities.

verses.kjv: And they shall know that I am the LORD, when I have set a fire in Egypt, and when all her helpers shall be destroyed.
verses.web: They will know that I am LORD when I have set a fire in Egypt, and all her helpers are destroyed.
verses.ct: Then they will know that I am the LORD — when I set Egypt on fire and every ally she counted on is destroyed.

verses.kjv: In that day shall messengers go forth from me in ships to make the careless Ethiopians afraid, and great pain shall come upon them, as in the day of Egypt: for, lo, it cometh.
verses.web: “ ‘ “In that day messengers will go out from before me in ships to make the careless Ethiopians afraid. There will be anguish on them, as in the day of Egypt; for, behold, it comes.”
verses.ct: On that day, I will send messengers in ships to shatter the confidence of the Ethiopians, who feel so safe. Terror will grip them just as it gripped Egypt. Watch — it is coming.

verses.kjv: Thus saith the Lord GOD; I will also make the multitude of Egypt to cease by the hand of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon.
verses.web: “ ‘The Lord LORD says: “I will also make the multitude of Egypt to cease, by the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon.
verses.ct: This is what the Lord GOD says: I will wipe out Egypt's vast population through Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon.

verses.kjv: He and his people with him, the terrible of the nations, shall be brought to destroy the land: and they shall draw their swords against Egypt, and fill the land with the slain.
verses.web: He and his people with him, the terrible of the nations, will be brought in to destroy the land. They will draw their swords against Egypt, and fill the land with the slain.
verses.ct: He and his army — the most ruthless nation on earth — will be brought in to destroy the land. They will draw their swords against Egypt and fill the country with corpses.

verses.kjv: And I will make the rivers dry, and sell the land into the hand of the wicked: and I will make the land waste, and all that is therein, by the hand of strangers: I the LORD have spoken it.
verses.web: I will make the rivers dry, and will sell the land into the hand of evil men. I will make the land desolate, and all that is therein, by the hand of strangers: I, LORD, have spoken it.”
verses.ct: I will dry up the rivers and hand the land over to wicked men. I will lay waste to everything in it through the hands of foreigners. I, the LORD, have spoken.

verses.kjv: Thus saith the Lord GOD; I will also destroy the idols, and I will cause their images to cease out of Noph; and there shall be no more a prince of the land of Egypt: and I will put a fear in the land of Egypt.
verses.web: “ ‘The Lord LORD says: “I will also destroy the idols, and I will cause the images to cease from Memphis. There will be no more a prince from the land of Egypt. I will put a fear in the land of Egypt.
verses.ct: This is what the Lord GOD says: I will also smash the idols and put an end to the false images in Noph. Egypt will never again have a native prince ruling over it, and I will spread fear throughout the land.

verses.kjv: And I will make Pathros desolate, and will set fire in Zoan, and will execute judgments in No.
verses.web: I will make Pathros desolate, and will set a fire in Zoan, and will execute judgments on No.
verses.ct: I will make Pathros a wasteland, set Zoan on fire, and carry out judgment against No.

verses.kjv: And I will pour my fury upon Sin, the strength of Egypt; and I will cut off the multitude of No.
verses.web: I will pour my wrath on Sin, the stronghold of Egypt. I will cut off the multitude of No.
verses.ct: I will pour out my fury on Sin, Egypt's fortress, and I will cut down the masses of No.

verses.kjv: And I will set fire in Egypt: Sin shall have great pain, and No shall be rent asunder, and Noph shall have distresses daily.
verses.web: I will set a fire in Egypt Sin will be in great anguish. No will be broken up. Memphis will have adversaries in the daytime.
verses.ct: I will set Egypt ablaze. Sin will be in agony, No will be ripped apart, and Noph will face enemies attacking in broad daylight.

verses.kjv: The young men of Aven and of Pibeseth shall fall by the sword: and these cities shall go into captivity.
verses.web: The young men of Aven and of Pibeseth will fall by the sword. They will go into captivity.
verses.ct: The young soldiers of Aven and Pibeseth will die by the sword, and the people of those cities will be dragged off into captivity.

verses.kjv: At Tehaphnehes also the day shall be darkened, when I shall break there the yokes of Egypt: and the pomp of her strength shall cease in her: as for her, a cloud shall cover her, and her daughters shall go into captivity.
verses.web: At Tehaphnehes also the day will withdraw itself, when I break the yokes of Egypt, there. The pride of her power will cease in her. As for her, a cloud will cover her, and her daughters will go into captivity.
verses.ct: At Tehaphnehes, the day will go dark when I shatter Egypt's yoke of power there. The strength she boasted about will come to an end. A cloud will cover her, and her surrounding towns will be taken into captivity.

verses.kjv: Thus will I execute judgments in Egypt: and they shall know that I am the LORD.
verses.web: Thus I will execute judgments on Egypt. Then they will know that I am LORD.” ’ ”
verses.ct: This is how I will carry out judgment on Egypt. Then they will know that I am the LORD."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass in the eleventh year, in the first month, in the seventh day of the month, that the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,
verses.web: In the eleventh year, in the first month, in the seventh day of the month, LORD’s word came to me, saying,
verses.ct: On the 7th day of the 1st month, in the 11th year, the word of the LORD came to me:

verses.kjv: Son of man, I have broken the arm of Pharaoh king of Egypt; and, lo, it shall not be bound up to be healed, to put a roller to bind it, to make it strong to hold the sword.
verses.web: “Son of man, I have broken the arm of Pharaoh king of Egypt. Behold, it has not been bound up, to apply medicines, to put a bandage to bind it, that it become strong to hold the sword.
verses.ct: "Son of man, I have broken the arm of Pharaoh king of Egypt. Look — no one has bandaged it or put a splint on it to let it heal so he could grip a sword again.

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the Lord GOD; Behold, I am against Pharaoh king of Egypt, and will break his arms, the strong, and that which was broken; and I will cause the sword to fall out of his hand.
verses.web: Therefore the Lord LORD says: ‘Behold, I am against Pharaoh king of Egypt, and will break his arms, the strong arm, and that which was broken. I will cause the sword to fall out of his hand.
verses.ct: So this is what the Lord GOD says: I am against Pharaoh king of Egypt. I will break both his arms — the one still strong and the one already broken — and I will knock the sword right out of his hand.

verses.kjv: And I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations, and will disperse them through the countries.
verses.web: I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations, and will disperse them through the countries.
verses.ct: I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations and disperse them across foreign lands.

verses.kjv: And I will strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon, and put my sword in his hand: but I will break Pharaoh’s arms, and he shall groan before him with the groanings of a deadly wounded man.
verses.web: I will strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon, and put my sword in his hand; but I will break the arms of Pharaoh, and he will groan before the king of Babylon with the groaning of a mortally wounded man.
verses.ct: At the same time, I will strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon and place my own sword in his hand. But I will break Pharaoh's arms, and he will groan before Babylon's king like a man dying from his wounds.

verses.kjv: But I will strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon, and the arms of Pharaoh shall fall down; and they shall know that I am the LORD, when I shall put my sword into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he shall stretch it out upon the land of Egypt.
verses.web: I will hold up the arms of the king of Babylon; and the arms of Pharaoh will fall down. Then they will know that I am LORD, when I put my sword into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he stretches it out on the land of Egypt.
verses.ct: I will make the king of Babylon's arms strong while Pharaoh's arms go limp. Then everyone will know that I am the LORD — when I put my sword in the hand of Babylon's king and he raises it against the land of Egypt.

verses.kjv: And I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations, and disperse them among the countries; and they shall know that I am the LORD.
verses.web: I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations, and disperse them through the countries. Then they will know that I am LORD.’ ”
verses.ct: I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations and disperse them across foreign lands. Then they will know that I am the LORD."
